Badge.description: A badge is an award for "special performance" that can be given to the user. It is shown in the "Badges" tab to the user.

image.description: The URL of an image representing the badge.

name.description: The text that is shown with the badge.

Competence.description: The more detailed competences in a competence area. E.g. "IT security" in the security competence area.

name.description: The name of the competence as shown in the user interface.

subCompetences.description: The granular sub competences that are actually tested.

CompetenceArea.description: A competence area is a broad educational subject, such as security, compliance etc. All competence areas of all seasons published in a tenant are merged into a competence model that is shown to users. Competence areas and competences may be reused across seasons.

competences.description: The more detailed competences in this competence area.

name.description: The name of the competence area as shown in the user interface.

EpisodeDefinition.description: An episode of a season in talent::digital. An episode is a learning module of typically 5-20 minutes duration that tests some of the subcompetences in the season and offers learning material for failed tests.

badges.description: Badges that can be obtained by playing the episode.

description.description: The description of the episode as shown in the user interface.

format.description: The URL of the app that is run when the user runs the episode.

formatConfiguration.description: The URL of a configuration file that is passed to the app when it is run, e.g., to set up quiz questions.

imageUrl.description: The URL of an SVG preview image for the episode shown in the user interface.

maturity.description: The development status of the episode. This determines if the episode can be accessed by players generally in the user interface, or only through specific URLs.

title.description: The title of the episode as shown in the user interface.

LanguageCode.description: Language codes used for internationalised strings.

Level.description: The available difficulty levels of tests.

LocalizedSearchDefinition.description: A search specification for finding educational material for a topic depending on the language of the user.

LocalizedString.description: Localized strings represent text that is available in multiple languages. The user is shown text in their language, if the text in their language is configured; otherwise they see the text in the configured language, if only one language is configured; otherwise they see the text in the reference language ("de"?).

Maturity.description:
The maturity of the episode.
* "pending": Still under development.
* "alpha": Ready for alpha testing (e.g., first guided testing to determine usability issues).
* "beta": Ready for beta testing (e.g., unguided testing to determine test item differentiation).
* "public": Generally available for anyone to play it, if it has been unlocked by the administrator of the organisation.

SearchDefinition.description: A search specification for finding educational material for a topic in a particular language.

generic.description: A list of search queries to find education material.

links.description: A list of links with known education material.

tool.description: A list of tool-specific search queries to find education material. These search queries get the user-configured tool added.

SeasonDefinition.description: Configuration of a season in talent::digital.

competenceAreas.description: The competences that this season addresses in the talent::digital competence model. The ID identifies the competence and should be globally unique.

episodes.description: The episodes (learning modules) to verify the competences. The ID can be simply e.g. "01", "02", ... It permits rearranging episodes in a season without loosing any previously generated data from players.

info.description: A description of what the season is about.

seasonEndMessage.description: A rewarding message to the player when they finish the season.

SubCompetence.description: A sub competence is actually tested by talent::digital test items. E.g., "Password security" in the "IT security" competence.

name.description: The name of the subcompetence as shown in the user interface.

testItems.description: The tests to validate the subcompetence.

TestItem.description: Test items are tests executed in talent::digital episodes as evidence that a user possesses a certain subcompetence.

documentation.description: A text describing the action required for the test.

level.description: The difficulty level of the test item.

search.description: A search specification for finding educational material around the test and the subcompetence.

toolType.description: The type of tool that is used for the test. E.g., "chat" or "video-conferencing". This tool is matched against the tools configured by the administrator for the organization.

ToolType.description: The available tool types that can be configured in the user interface.

URL.description: A URL to an asset or app. The URL is either relative to the current repository or absolute to an already deployed asset or app.
